parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Usefulness, profit, advantage, benefit, gain. From a derivative of the base of ophelimos; usefulness, i.e. Benefit.
